plot: Emma is a divorced woman with a teen aged boy who moves into a small town and tries to make a go of a horse ranch. Murphy is the town druggist who steers business her way. Things are going ...

title: A Little Romance
plot: A French boy (Daniel) and an American girl (Lauren), who goes to school in Paris, meet and begin a little romance. They befriend Julius who enchants them with his storytelling. In an ...

title: Guilty of Romance
plot: A grisly murder occurs in Maruyama-cho, Shibuya, Tokyo - a love hotel district - a woman was found dead in a derelict apartment. Kazuko (Miki Mizuno) is a police officer called to ...

title: Tillie's Punctured Romance
plot: Charlie talks wealthy farmer's daughter Tillie into eloping with him (and taking her father's money). In the city Tillie gets drunk and lands in jail while Charlie runs off with her money ...

title: A Cruel Romance
plot: Cinematographic adaptation of classical Russian play "Dowry-less" by A. Ostrovsky. Noble but poor widow seeks to arrange marriage for her three daughters. She maintains "open house" or ...

title: Modern Romance
plot: Albert Brooks directs himself as a successful film editor with far too many issues that affects the relationship between him and his remarkably patient girlfriend.

title: Little Miss Sunshine
plot: A family determined to get their young daughter into the finals of a beauty pageant take a cross-country trip in their VW bus.

tomato.consensus: Little Miss Sunshine succeeds thanks to a strong ensemble cast that includes Greg Kinnear, Steve Carell, Toni Collette, Alan Arkin, and Abigail Breslin, as well as a delightfully funny script.

title: The Little Mermaid
plot: A mermaid princess makes a Faustian bargain with an unscrupulous sea-witch in order to meet a human prince on land.

title: Stuart Little
plot: The Little family adopt a charming young mouse named Stuart, but the family cat wants rid of him.

tomato.consensus: Critics say Stuart Little is charming with kids and adults for its humor and visual effects.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 7 wins & 12 nominations.

title: Big Trouble in Little China
plot: An All-American trucker gets dragged into a centuries-old mystical battle in Chinatown.

title: Little Fockers
plot: Family-patriarch Jack Byrnes wants to appoint a successor. Does his son-in-law, the male nurse Greg Focker have what it takes?

tomato.consensus: As star-studded as it is heartbreakingly lazy, Little Fockers takes the top-grossing trilogy to embarrassing new lows.

title: Little Nicky
plot: After two of the devil's three sons escape Hell to wreak havoc on Earth, the devil must send his third son, the mild-mannered Nicky, to bring them back before it's too late.

tomato.consensus: Despite the presence of a large, talented cast, the jokes in Little Nicky are dumb, tasteless, and not that funny, and Adam Sandler's character is grating to watch.

title: Chicken Little
plot: After ruining his reputation with the town, a courageous chicken must come to the rescue of his fellow citizens when aliens start an invasion.

tomato.consensus: In its first non-Pixar CGI venture, Disney expends more effort in the technical presentation than in crafting an original storyline.

title: Little Shop of Horrors
plot: A nerdy florist finds his chance for success and romance with the help of a giant man-eating plant who demands to be fed.

tomato.consensus: Remixing Roger Corman's B-movie by way of the Off-Broadway musical, Little Shop of Horrors offers camp, horror and catchy tunes in equal measure -- plus some inspired cameos by the likes of Steve Martin and Bill Murray.

awards.text: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 2 wins & 11 nominations.

title: Little Women
plot: The March sisters live and grow in post-Civil War America.

awards.text: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 5 wins & 13 nominations.

title: Stuart Little 2
plot: Stuart and Snowbell set out across town to rescue a friend.

tomato.consensus: Stuart Little 2 is a sweet, visually impressive sequel that provides wholesome entertainment for kids.

title: Crazy Heart
plot: A faded country music musician is forced to reassess his dysfunctional life during a doomed romance that also inspires him.

tomato.consensus: Thanks to a captivating performance from Jeff Bridges, Crazy Heart transcends its overly familiar origins and finds new meaning in an old story.

title: Angel Heart
plot: Harry Angel is a private investigator. He is hired by a man who calls himself Louis Cyphre to track down a singer called Johnny Favorite. But the investigation takes an unexpected and somber turn.

title: Wild at Heart
plot: Young lovers Sailor and Lula run from the variety of weirdos that Lula's mom has hired to kill Sailor.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 2 wins & 6 nominations.

title: I Heart Huckabees
plot: A husband-and-wife team play detective, but not in the traditional sense. Instead, the happy duo helps others solve their existential issues, the kind that keep you up at night, wondering what it all means.

title: Whisper of the Heart
plot: A love story between a girl who loves reading books, and the boy who has previously checked out all of the library books she chooses.

title: Where the Heart Is
plot: A pregnant 17-year-old rebuilds her life after being abandoned by her boyfriend at a Wal-Mart in Sequoyah, Oklahoma.

tomato.consensus: Poor script and messy plot undermines the decent cast.

title: A Mighty Heart
plot: Mariane Pearl embarks on a frantic search to locate her journalist husband, Daniel, when he goes missing in Pakistan.

tomato.consensus: Angelina Jolie conveys the full emotional range of a woman in a desperate situation in A Mighty Heart, an urgent yet tactful film about a difficult subject.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 4 wins & 17 nominations.

title: The Normal Heart
plot: A gay activist attempts to raise HIV/AIDS awareness during the early 1980s.

awards.text: Won 1 Golden Globe. Another 20 wins & 51 nominations.

title: Playing by Heart
plot: Eleven articulate people work through affairs of the heart in L.A.

title: The Beat That My Heart Skipped
plot: Will Thomas still lead a life of crime and cruelty, just like his thuggish father, or will he pursue his dream of becoming a pianist?

tomato.consensus: Stylish and visceral, this able remake is infused with realism, grit, and a taut performance by star Romain Duris.

awards.text: Won 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 20 wins & 11 nominations.

title: The Big Lebowski
plot: "The Dude" Lebowski, mistaken for a millionaire Lebowski, seeks restitution for his ruined rug and enlists his bowling buddies to help get it.

tomato.consensus: Typically stunning visuals and sharp dialogue from the Coen Brothers, brought to life with strong performances from Goodman and Bridges.

title: Big Fish
plot: A son tries to learn more about his dying father by reliving stories and myths he told about his life.

tomato.consensus: A charming father-and-son tale filled with typical Tim Burton flourishes.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 1 win & 46 nominations.

title: Big Hero 6
plot: The special bond that develops between plus-sized inflatable robot Baymax, and prodigy Hiro Hamada, who team up with a group of friends to form a band of high-tech heroes.

tomato.consensus: Agreeably entertaining and brilliantly animated, Big Hero 6 is briskly-paced, action-packed, and often touching.

title: Big Daddy
plot: A lazy law school grad adopts a kid to impress his girlfriend, but everything doesn't go as planned and he becomes the unlikely foster father.

tomato.consensus: Adam Sandler acquits himself admirably, but his charm isn't enough to make up for Big Daddy's jarring shifts between crude humor and mawkish sentimentality.

title: Big
plot: When a boy wishes to be big at a magic wish machine, he wakes up the next morning and finds himself in an adult body.

tomato.consensus: Refreshingly sweet and undeniably funny, Big is a showcase for Tom Hanks, who dives into his role and infuses it with charm and surprising poignancy.

awards.text: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 11 wins & 12 nominations.

title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
plot: A young Greek woman falls in love with a non-Greek and struggles to get her family to accept him while she comes to terms with her heritage and cultural identity.

tomato.consensus: Though it sometimes feels like a television sitcom, My Big Fat Greek Wedding is good-hearted, lovable, and delightfully eccentric, with a sharp script and lead performance from Nia Vardalos.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 18 wins & 24 nominations.

title: Big Momma's House
plot: To protect a woman (Nia Long) and her son (Jascha Washington) from a robber (Terrence Howard), a male FBI agent (Martin Lawrence) disguises as a large grandmother.

tomato.consensus: Big Momma's House is funny in some parts, but it is essentially a one-joke movie.

title: The Big Sleep
plot: Private detective Philip Marlowe is hired by a rich family. Before the complex case is over, he's seen murder, blackmail, and what might be love.

title: In Time
plot: In a future where people stop aging at 25, but are engineered to live only one more year, having the means to buy your way out of the situation is a shot at immortal youth. Here, Will Salas finds himself accused of murder and on the run with a hostage - a connection that becomes an important part of the way against the system.

tomato.consensus: In Time's intriguing premise and appealing cast are easily overpowered by the blunt, heavy-handed storytelling.

title: Big Eyes
plot: A drama about the awakening of the painter Margaret Keane, her phenomenal success in the 1950s, and the subsequent legal difficulties she had with her husband, who claimed credit for her works in the 1960s.

tomato.consensus: Well-acted, thought-provoking, and a refreshing change of pace for Tim Burton, Big Eyes works both as a biopic and as a timelessly relevant piece of social commentary.

awards.text: Won 1 Golden Globe. Another 1 win & 15 nominations.

title: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
plot: A young fugitive prince and princess must stop a villain who unknowingly threatens to destroy the world with a special dagger that enables the magic sand inside to reverse time.

tomato.consensus: It doesn't offer much in the way of substance, but Prince of Persia is a suitably entertaining swashbuckler -- and a substantial improvement over most video game adaptations.

title: Once Upon a Time in America
plot: A former Prohibition-era Jewish gangster returns to the Lower East Side of Manhattan over thirty years later, where he once again must confront the ghosts and regrets of his old life.

awards.text: Nominated for 2 Golden Globes. Another 11 wins & 7 nominations.

title: Once Upon a Time in Mexico
plot: Hitman "El Mariachi" becomes involved in international espionage involving a psychotic CIA agent and a corrupt Mexican general.

tomato.consensus: Violent, pulpy, loopy fun, with Depp stealing the show.

title: Hot Tub Time Machine
plot: A malfunctioning time machine at a ski resort takes a man back to 1986 with his two friends and nephew, where they must relive a fateful night and not change anything to make sure the nephew is born.

tomato.consensus: Its flagrantly silly script -- and immensely likable cast -- make up for most of its flaws.

title: A Time to Kill
plot: A young lawyer defends a black man accused of murdering two men who raped his 10-year-old daughter, sparking a rebirth of the K.K.K.

tomato.consensus: Overlong and superficial, A Time to Kill nonetheless succeeds on the strength of its skillful craftsmanship and top-notch performances.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 7 wins & 10 nominations.

title: The Time Traveler's Wife
plot: A romantic drama about a Chicago librarian with a gene that causes him to involuntarily time travel, and the complications it creates for his marriage.

tomato.consensus: Though it may satisfy fans of the novel, The Time Traveler's Wife's plot contrivances and illogical narrative hamper its big screen effectiveness.

title: The Time Machine
plot: Hoping to alter the events of the past, a 19th century inventor instead travels 800,000 years into the future, where he finds humankind divided into two warring races.

tomato.consensus: This Machine has all the razzle-dazzles of modern special effects, but the movie takes a turn for the worst when it switches from a story about lost love to a confusing action-thriller.

title: Lagaan: Once Upon a Time in India
plot: The people of a small village in Victorian India stake their future on a game of cricket against their ruthless British rulers.

tomato.consensus: Lagaan is lavish, rousing entertainment in the old-fashioned tradition of Hollywood musicals.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 44 wins & 19 nominations.

title: Gone Girl
plot: With his wife's disappearance having become the focus of an intense media circus, a man sees the spotlight turned on him when it's suspected that he may not be innocent.

tomato.consensus: Dark, intelligent, and stylish to a fault, Gone Girl plays to director David Fincher's sick strengths while bringing the best out of stars Ben Affleck and Rosamund Pike.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 59 wins & 155 nominations.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
plot: Journalist Mikael Blomkvist is aided in his search for a woman who has been missing for forty years by Lisbeth Salander, a young computer hacker.

tomato.consensus: Brutal yet captivating, The Girl With the Dragon Tattoo is the result of David Fincher working at his lurid best with total role commitment from star Rooney Mara.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
plot: A journalist is aided in his search for a woman who has been missing -- or dead -- for forty years by a young female hacker.

tomato.consensus: Its graphic violence and sprawling length will prove too much for some viewers to take, but Noomi Rapace's gripping performance makes The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo an unforgettable viewing experience.

awards.text: Won 2 BAFTA Film Awards. Another 17 wins & 34 nominations.

title: The Girl Next Door
plot: A teenager's dreams come true when a former porn star moves in next door and they fall in love.

tomato.consensus: The movie borrows heavily from Risky Business, though Hirsch and Cuthbert are appealing leads.

title: Girl, Interrupted
plot: Based on writer Susanna Kaysen's account of her 18-month stay at a mental hospital in the 1960s.

tomato.consensus: Angelina Jolie gives an intense performance, but overall Girl, Interrupted suffers from thin, predictable plotting that fails to capture the power of its source material.

title: Lars and the Real Girl
plot: A delusional young man strikes up an unconventional relationship with a doll he finds on the Internet.

tomato.consensus: Lars and the Real Girl could've so easily been a one-joke movie. But the talented cast, a great script, and direction never condescends to its character or the audience.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 6 wins & 31 nominations.

title: The Other Boleyn Girl
plot: Two sisters contend for the affection of King Henry VIII.

tomato.consensus: Though it features some extravagant and entertaining moments, The Other Boleyn Girl feels more like a soap opera than historical drama.

title: The Girl Who Played with Fire
plot: As computer hacker Lisbeth and journalist Mikael investigate a sex-trafficking ring, Lisbeth is accused of three murders, causing her to go on the run while Mikael works to clear her name.

tomato.consensus: Noomi Rapace and Michael Nyqvist remain extraordinarily well-suited to their roles, but the second installment in Stieg Larsson's Millennium Trilogy doesn't pack quite as much punch as the first.

title: Girl with a Pearl Earring
plot: A young peasant maid working in the house of painter Johannes Vermeer becomes his talented assistant and the model for one of his most famous works.

tomato.consensus: Visually arresting, but the story could be told with a bit more energy.

awards.text: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 17 wins & 41 nominations.

title: My Girl
plot: A young girl, on the threshold of her teen years, finds her life turning upside down, when she is accompanied by an unlikely friend.

title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
plot: A cyborg, identical to the one who failed to kill Sarah Connor, must now protect her young son, John Connor, from a more advanced cyborg, made out of liquid metal.

tomato.consensus: T2 features thrilling action sequences and eye-popping visual effects, but what takes this sci-fi/ action landmark to the next level is the depth of the human (and cyborg) characters.

title: Groundhog Day
plot: A weatherman finds himself living the same day over and over again.

tomato.consensus: Smart, sweet, and inventive, Groundhog Day highlights Murray's dramatic gifts while still leaving plenty of room for laughs.

awards.text: Won 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 5 wins & 8 nominations.

title: Independence Day
plot: The aliens are coming and their goal is to invade and destroy Earth. Fighting superior technology, mankind's best weapon is the will to survive.

tomato.consensus: The plot is thin and so is character development, but as a thrilling, spectacle-filled summer movie, Independence Day delivers.

title: The Day After Tomorrow
plot: Jack Hall, paleoclimatologist, must make a daring trek across America to reach his son, trapped in the cross-hairs of a sudden international storm which plunges the planet into a new Ice Age.

tomato.consensus: A ludicrous popcorn flick filled with clunky dialogues, but spectacular visuals save it from being a total disaster.

awards.text: Won 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 5 wins & 9 nominations.

title: Training Day
plot: On his first day on the job as a Los Angeles narcotics officer, a rookie cop goes on a 24-hour training course with a rogue detective who isn't what he appears.

tomato.consensus: The ending may be less than satisfying, but Denzel Washington reminds us why he's such a great actor in this taut and brutal police drama.

title: Ferris Bueller's Day Off
plot: A high school wise guy is determined to have a day off from school, despite what the principal thinks of that.

tomato.consensus: Matthew Broderick charms in Ferris Bueller's Day Off, a light and irrepressibly fun movie about being young and having fun.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 1 win.

title: Dog Day Afternoon
plot: A man robs a bank to pay for his lover's operation; it turns into a hostage situation and a media circus.

title: Die Another Day
plot: James Bond is sent to investigate the connection between a North Korean terrorist and a diamond mogul who is funding the development of an international space weapon.

tomato.consensus: Its action may be bit too over-the-top for some, but Die Another Day is lavishly crafted and succeeds in evoking classic Bond themes from the franchise's earlier installments.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 5 wins & 29 nominations.

title: A Good Day to Die Hard
plot: John McClane travels to Russia to help out his seemingly wayward son, Jack, only to discover that Jack is a CIA operative working undercover, causing the father and son to team up against underworld forces.

tomato.consensus: A Good Day to Die Hard is the weakest entry in a storied franchise, and not even Bruce Willis' smirking demeanor can enliven a cliched, uninspired script.

title: Knight and Day
plot: A young woman gets mixed up with a disgraced spy who is trying to clear his name.

tomato.consensus: It's pure formula, but thanks to its breezy pace and a pair of charming performances from Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz, Knight and Day offers some agreeably middle-of-the-road summer action.

title: World War Z
plot: United Nations employee Gerry Lane traverses the world in a race against time to stop the Zombie pandemic that is toppling armies and governments, and threatening to destroy humanity itself.

tomato.consensus: It's uneven and diverges from the source book, but World War Z still brings smart, fast-moving thrills and a solid performance from Brad Pitt to the zombie genre.

title: Thor: The Dark World
plot: When Dr Jane Foster gets cursed with a powerful object, Thor must protect it before an army and its ruthless leader try to get their hands on it to take over the remains of Earth.

tomato.consensus: It may not be the finest film to come from the Marvel Universe, but Thor: The Dark World still offers plenty of the humor and high-stakes action that fans have come to expect.

title: Jurassic World
plot: A new theme park is built on the original site of Jurassic Park. Everything is going well until the park's newest attraction--a genetically modified giant stealth killing machine--escapes containment and goes on a killing spree.

tomato.consensus: Jurassic World can't match the original for sheer inventiveness and impact, but it works in its own right as an entertaining -- and visually dazzling -- popcorn thriller.

title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
plot: Scott Pilgrim must defeat his new girlfriend's seven evil exes in order to win her heart.

tomato.consensus: Its script may not be as dazzling as its eye-popping visuals, but Scott Pilgrim vs. the World is fast, funny, and inventive.

title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
plot: During the Napoleonic Wars, a brash British captain pushes his ship and crew to their limits in pursuit of a formidable French war vessel around South America.

tomato.consensus: Russell Crowe's rough charm is put to good use in this masterful adaptation of Patrick O'Brian's novel.

title: The World Is Not Enough
plot: James Bond uncovers a nuclear plot when he protects an oil heiress from her former kidnapper, an international terrorist who can't feel pain.

tomato.consensus: Plagued by mediocre writing, uneven acting, and a fairly by-the-numbers plot, The World Is Not Enough is partially saved by some entertaining and truly Bond-worthy action sequences.

title: Wayne's World
plot: Two slacker friends try to promote their public-access cable show.

tomato.consensus: An oddball comedy that revels in its silliness and memorable catch phrases, Wayne's World is also fondly regarded because of its endearing characters.

title: Team America: World Police
plot: Popular Broadway actor Gary Johnston is recruited by the elite counter-terrorism organization Team America: World Police. As the world begins to crumble around him, he must battle with terrorists, celebrities and falling in love.

tomato.consensus: Team America will either offend you or leave you in stitches. It'll probably do both.

title: Ghost World
plot: With only the plan of moving in together after high school, two unusually devious friends seek direction in life. As a mere gag, they respond to a man's newspaper ad for a date, only to find it will greatly complicate their lives.

tomato.consensus: With acerbic wit, Terry Zwigoff fashions Daniel Clowes' graphic novel into an intelligent, comedic trip through deadpan teen angst.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 26 wins & 53 nominations.

title: Night at the Museum
plot: A newly recruited night security guard at the Museum of Natural History discovers that an ancient curse causes the animals and exhibits on display to come to life and wreak havoc.

tomato.consensus: Parents might call this either a spectacle-filled adventure or a shallow and vapid CG-fest, depending on whether they choose to embrace this on the same level as their kids.

title: 30 Days of Night
plot: After an Alaskan town is plunged into darkness for a month, it is attacked by a bloodthirsty gang of vampires.

tomato.consensus: While 30 Days of Night offers a few thrills, it ultimately succumbs to erratic execution.

title: Date Night
plot: In New York City, a case of mistaken identity turns a bored married couple's attempt at a glamorous and romantic evening into something more thrilling and dangerous.

tomato.consensus: An uneasy blend of action and comedy, Date Night doesn't quite live up to the talents of its two leads, but Steve Carell and Tina Fey still manage to shine through most of the movie's flaws.

title: Good Night, and Good Luck.
plot: Broadcast journalist Edward R. Murrow looks to bring down Senator Joseph McCarthy.

tomato.consensus: A passionate and concise cinematic civics lesson, Good Night, And Good Luck has plenty to say about today's political and cultural climate, and its ensemble cast is stellar.

awards.text: Nominated for 6 Oscars. Another 37 wins & 110 nominations.

title: The Night of the Hunter
director: Charles Laughton, Robert Mitchum, Terry Sanders
plot: A religious fanatic marries a gullible widow whose young children are reluctant to tell him where their real daddy hid $10,000 he'd stolen in a robbery.

tomato.consensus: Featuring Robert Mitchum's formidable performance as child-hunting preacher, The Night of the Hunter is a disturbing look at good and evil.

title: Fright Night
plot: A teenager suspects that his new neighbor is a vampire.

tomato.consensus: It may not have been necessary to remake the 1985 cult classic, but the new Fright Night benefits from terrific performances by Colin Farrell and David Tennant -- and it's smart, funny, and stylishly gory to boot.

title: We Own the Night
plot: A New York nightclub manager tries to save his brother and father from Russian mafia hit men.

tomato.consensus: Bland characters, clichéd dialogue and rickety plotting ensure We Own The Night never lives up to its potential.

title: Run All Night
plot: Mobster and hit man Jimmy Conlon has one night to figure out where his loyalties lie: with his estranged son, Mike, whose life is in danger, or his longtime best friend, mob boss Shawn Maguire, who wants Mike to pay for the death of his own son.

tomato.consensus: Liam Neeson is in typically fine form, but Run All Night suffers from a convoluted plot and workmanlike execution.

title: Night at the Museum: Secret of the Tomb
plot: Larry spans the globe, uniting favorite and new characters while embarking on an epic quest to save the magic before it is gone forever.

tomato.consensus: While not without its moments, Night at the Museum: Secret of the Tomb is a less-than-inspired sendoff for the trilogy.

title: Iron Man
plot: After being held captive in an Afghan cave, an industrialist creates a unique weaponized suit of armor to fight evil.

tomato.consensus: Director Jon Favreau and star Robert Downey Jr. make this smart, high impact superhero movie one that even non-comics fans can enjoy.

awards.text: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 19 wins & 58 nominations.

title: Iron Man 3
plot: When Tony Stark's world is torn apart by a formidable terrorist called the Mandarin, he starts an odyssey of rebuilding and retribution.

tomato.consensus: With the help of its charismatic lead, some impressive action sequences, and even a few surprises, Iron Man 3 is a witty, entertaining adventure and a strong addition to the Marvel canon.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 17 wins & 52 nominations.

title: Spider-Man
plot: When bitten by a genetically modified spider, a nerdy, shy, and awkward high school student gains spider-like abilities that he eventually must use to fight evil as a superhero after tragedy befalls his family.

awards.text: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 13 wins & 48 nominations.

title: Man of Steel
plot: Clark Kent, one of the last of an extinguished race disguised as an unremarkable human, is forced to reveal his identity when Earth is invaded by an army of survivors who threaten to bring the planet to the brink of destruction.

tomato.consensus: Man of Steel provides exhilarating action and spectacle to overcome its detours into generic blockbuster territory.

title: Iron Man 2
plot: With the world now aware of his identity as Iron Man, Tony Stark must contend with both his declining health and a vengeful mad man with ties to his father's legacy.

tomato.consensus: It isn't quite the breath of fresh air that Iron Man was, but this sequel comes close with solid performances and an action-packed plot.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 7 wins & 40 nominations.

title: The Amazing Spider-Man
plot: After Peter Parker is bitten by a genetically altered spider, he gains newfound, spider-like powers and ventures out to solve the mystery of his parent's mysterious death.

tomato.consensus: A well-chosen cast and sure-handed direction allow The Amazing Spider-Man to thrill, despite revisiting many of the same plot points from 2002's Spider-Man.

title: Spider-Man 2
plot: Peter Parker is beset with troubles in his failing personal life as he battles a brilliant scientist named Doctor Otto Octavius.

tomato.consensus: Boasting an entertaining villain and deeper emotional focus, this is a nimble sequel that improves upon the original.

title: Rain Man
plot: Selfish yuppie Charlie Babbitt's father left a fortune to his savant brother Raymond and a pittance to Charlie; they travel cross-country.

tomato.consensus: This road-trip movie about an autistic savant and his callow brother is far from seamless, but Barry Levinson's direction is impressive, and strong performances from Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman add to its appeal.

title: Spider-Man 3
plot: A strange black entity from another world bonds with Peter Parker and causes inner turmoil as he contends with new villains, temptations, and revenge.

tomato.consensus: Though there are more characters and plotlines, and the action sequences still dazzle, Spider-Man 3 nonetheless isn't quite as refined as the first two.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 3 wins & 31 nominations.

title: The Amazing Spider-Man 2
plot: When New York is put under siege by Oscorp, it is up to Spider-Man to save the city he swore to protect as well as his loved ones.

tomato.consensus: While the cast is outstanding and the special effects are top-notch, the latest installment of the Spidey saga suffers from an unfocused narrative and an overabundance of characters.

title: Toy Story
plot: A cowboy doll is profoundly threatened and jealous when a new spaceman figure supplants him as top toy in a boy's room.

tomato.consensus: Entertaining as it is innovative, Toy Story reinvigorated animation while heralding the arrival of Pixar as a family-friendly force to be reckoned with.

awards.text: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 22 wins & 17 nominations.

title: Toy Story 3
plot: The toys are mistakenly delivered to a day-care center instead of the attic right before Andy leaves for college, and it's up to Woody to convince the other toys that they weren't abandoned and to return home.

tomato.consensus: Deftly blending comedy, adventure, and honest emotion, Toy Story 3 is a rare second sequel that really works.

title: Toy Story 2
director: John Lasseter, Ash Brannon, Lee Unkrich
plot: When Woody is stolen by a toy collector, Buzz and his friends vow to rescue him, but Woody finds the idea of immortality in a museum tempting.

tomato.consensus: The rare sequel that arguably improves on its predecessor, Toy Story 2 uses inventive storytelling, gorgeous animation, and a talented cast to deliver another rich moviegoing experience for all ages.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 20 wins & 27 nominations.

title: Perfume: The Story of a Murderer
plot: Jean-Baptiste Grenouille, born with a superior olfactory sense, creates the world's finest perfume. His work, however, takes a dark turn as he searches for the ultimate scent.

tomato.consensus: Perfume is what you'd expect from a Tom Twyker-directed movie glamorizing a serial killer: a kinetic visual feast, with a dark antihero that's impossible to feel sympathy for.

title: Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story
plot: A group of misfits enter a Las Vegas dodgeball tournament in order to save their cherished local gym from the onslaught of a corporate health fitness chain.

tomato.consensus: Proudly profane and splendidly silly, Dodgeball is a worthy spiritual successor to the goofball comedies of the 1980s.

title: A Christmas Story
plot: Ralphie has to convince his parents, his teacher, and Santa that a Red Ryder B.B. gun really is the perfect gift for the 1940s.

tomato.consensus: Both warmly nostalgic and darkly humorous, A Christmas Story deserves its status as a holiday perennial.

title: It's Kind of a Funny Story
plot: A clinically depressed teenager gets a new start after he checks himself into an adult psychiatric ward.

tomato.consensus: It's amiable, and it does a surprisingly good job of sidestepping psych ward comedy cliches, but given its talented cast and directors, It's Kind of a Funny Story should be more than just mildly entertaining.

title: The NeverEnding Story
plot: A troubled boy dives into a wonderous fantasy world through the pages of a mysterious book.

tomato.consensus: A magical journey about the power of a young boy's imagination to save a dying fantasy land, The NeverEnding Story remains a much-loved kids adventure.

title: The Straight Story
plot: An old man makes a long journey by lawn-mover tractor to mend his relationship with an ill brother.

tomato.consensus: Slow-paced but heart-warming.

awards.text: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 13 wins & 35 nominations.

title: Life of Pi
plot: A young man who survives a disaster at sea is hurtled into an epic journey of adventure and discovery. While cast away, he forms an unexpected connection with another survivor: a fearsome Bengal tiger.

tomato.consensus: A 3D adaptation of a supposedly "unfilmable" book, Ang Lee's Life of Pi achieves the near impossible -- it's an astonishing technical achievement that's also emotionally rewarding.

title: Life Is Beautiful
plot: When an open-minded Jewish librarian and his son become victims of the Holocaust, he uses a perfect mixture of will, humor and imagination to protect his son from the dangers around their camp.

tomato.consensus: Benigni's earnest charm, when not overstepping its bounds into the unnecessarily treacly, offers the possibility of hope in the face of unflinching horror.

title: It's a Wonderful Life
plot: An angel helps a compassionate but despairingly frustrated businessman by showing what life would have been like if he never existed.

awards.text: Nominated for 5 Oscars. Another 6 wins & 1 nomination.

title: Life of Brian
plot: Brian is born on the original Christmas, in the stable next door. He spends his life being mistaken for a messiah.

title: An Inconvenient Truth

title: An Education

tomato.consensus: Though the latter part of the film may not appeal to all, An Education is a charming coming-of-age tale powered by the strength of relative newcomer Carey Mulligan's standout performance.
